topic.title: Declaration terminology
topic.shortdesc: When the model is expressed in a DTD or schema, various element types are declared.

body.p: When referring to the element-type declarations, the following terminology is used:JTH: Define specialized element, specialized attribute here?

dlentry.dd: The representation within a schema technology (such as DTD, XML Schema, or Relax NG) for an element type.
The representation within a schema technology (such as DTD, XML Schema, or Relax NG) for an attribute type.
The representation within a schema technology for the element and attribute types uniquely defined by a topic type, map type, or domain.
The representation within a schema technology for the element types uniquely defined by a topic type.
The representation within a schema technology for the element types uniquely defined by a map type.
The representation within a schema technology for the element types or attribute type uniquely defined by a domain.

The representation within a schema technology for a DTD shell or head schema that declares no element or attribute types itself (except potentially for a <dita> root element that allows multiple peer topic types in the same document type) but points to and assembles topic and domain modules or map and domain modules.Added mention of dita common pattern per Jeff OgdenMP added "head schema" terminology after review of schema module organization topic
The representation within a schema technology for a document type. The document type declaration includes the declaration modules assembled by the document declaration shell.
